title: Finding the Blast Furnace in Enshrouded

author: Wilhelm Arcturus

text: Our goal for the week was to collect the unlock for the blast furnace, the crafting station required for the next round of gear upgrades.  That meant braving a new game mechanic. Welcome to Enshrouded Up in the Albaneve Summits, above a specific altitude, the cold sets in and there is a whole frostbite mechanic that sets in. The flame at the top of the spire suggested this when we first got there, and you can experience the frost by just stepping out onto a balcony. The flame opines This is akin to the one in Valheim in the mountain biome, the difference being that in Enshrouded, it is a timer, akin to the shroud timer, so you’re never fully able to hang around forever in the frosty parts of the zone.  By default you get about two minutes of time before the cold starts to bite. Frostbite timer running down However, you can add points to your frost resistance, which adds time.  Things like the beef stew recipe and the pocket heater we unlocked last time around each have some frost resistance that will boost your time.  Ideally, you also want your gear to have frost resist as a stat as well, but much of that gear needs steel or refined silver, which requires the blast furnace.  We managed, across the group, to get between 6 and 12 minutes, with Potshot at the high end because there was one piece of gear with frost resist he could make, while Ula and I were at the lower end… though we couldn’t figure out why we were 3 minutes apart.  Still, we had a timer on how long we could be in the extreme cold at high altitude. But first we had to get there… which was, if not difficult in the end, a bit confusing due to the way the map looks.  The map in the game is a bit of a mix in that it has a pretty detailed set of contour lines showing changes in altitude, but it often doesn’t show much detail of the terrain otherwise.  And the contour lines as not consistent in that they don’t bunch up to indicate a steep slope the way they would on a decent USGS map.  So you can see some lines and it won’t be clear if that rise in terrain is something you can walk up or it is a barrier… not to mention that no paths or roads are shown. So it looked like if we glided down and went up a path I had scouted earlier on the far side of a mountain ridge, we would end up at our destination, as it was, on the map, right next to another quest objective about gathering Yak wool.  After a bit of climbing we made it there, a place that announced itself as the Quiet Caves, which did indeed have its share of yaks and fuzzy goats, the two tamable beasts up in the summits.  And there was also a cyclops. The quiet caves, with a not so quiet cyclops… also, we have our anniversary party hats on We got the quest update for arriving at the caves… we had already tamed a yak elsewhere and harvested wool, but the quest felt you needed to visit this particular spot on the map to have gotten the full experience… so it was time to take down the cyclops… which we did in fairly short order. Cyclops down I was enthused because for the next flame upgrade we needed a cyclops head.  However, this was just a run of the mill, every day cyclops and not the specific fel cyclops we needed, so that need remained unfulfilled. Having done that we set waypoints for the mark on the map for the blast furnace quest objective, which was only about 300 meters away according to the marker, and then spent a good 30 minutes discovering that it was on the other side of the ridge line we glided over, but not before wending our way around behind the ridge and into some deadly shroud. Enaldi gliding straight into the red shroud, which is the deadly shroud Enaldi managed to scamper back out of the red shroud before it killed her, but it was a near run thing.  And this is why we need that fel cyclops head, so we can upgrade the flame which will make that shroud accessible.  Don’t try to find the logic in it, it is just content gating.  We have to find a boss somewhere before we can get past that. After that wandering around it seemed pretty obvious that we needed to go up the other side of the ridge, up along the frozen river, up along a path that led into the mountain heights where the frost would begin to bite. We made our way up that path, hitting the very obvious snow line and then plowing forward into the mists… which included a section where we had both a frost timer and a shroud timer. There was some running about, and at least one dash back to below the snow line to reset timers and regroup.  You can put down a campfire in the cold to pause your timer, but it doesn’t regain any time.  You have to leave the frost zone for that. We eventually found a path up out of the shroud do a gate… open, but with a trap right in the doorway… that looked promising. This is athwart the path, so through it we’ll go We went in, battled the mobs that showed up.  We were still in a bit of a rush with our frost timers still ticking down.  In the end we found a path out the back of that area that led us up to another base around a large stone building. Here we go, this looks like the place There were some mobs outside to clear… and they were getting up into the 30s for levels, so no push overs for us… but we got that done and went in the front door to find a big smelting and metalworking environment… the right place clearly, and warm enough to reset the frost timers, so we were good on that front. It is nice and warm here There were a couple of mobs to deal with in the first room, but in the next was the Scavenger Tyrant, the boss we needed to defeat, which turned into quite a battle.  Potshot went down, but we managed to rally and defeat the tyrant.  That got us the keys to the blast furnace and some other goodies from the boss and the chest in his back room. We then went exploring, finding our way into a cave back behind the building which led down into a mine with more mobs, but also a range of items to harvest including iron, coal, and obsidian.  Always nice. Down in the cave Plus there as some more exposed magma in there, which heated the place up, so we were once again free of the frost timer and could fill up our bags.  There was even a repair station down there in case our picks were worn down. Some iron to harvest, with a coal seam up in the background Once we were done there, we recalled back to the spire where we started, then glided down to an Elixir Well that Potshot had scouted, both to chop down a shroud root for another skill point and to mine some silver he had spotted in the place. That done, it was back to base to setup the blast furnace and start the production of steel and silver. The blast furnace out in the workshop… I am sure the thatch roof won’t catch fire or anything Also, you can tell this came after the big patch as one of our NPCs has decided to sleep on the ground.  Despite having beds assigned, the NPCs now seem to just flop wherever they are standing when night falls or when they just feel like the need a nap. I went and crafted the tank armor set, which added quite a bit to my frost timer, which now runs close to 30 minutes. The new armor set, no cosmetics visible now That armor, plus a 90 damage single handed mace I picked up (along with that nice glowing sword I am wielding above), really increased my survivability.  I was able to rush my way past the mobs we battled with on our first trip up to reach the cave behind the blast furnace boss… though I avoided the boss… in order to harvest some more supplies. Now we need to find that fell cyclops head so that we can upgrade the flame once more which will allow us to access that bit of red shroud we ran into.  The word is that the cyclops we need is down an elixir well not to far from where we found the blast furnace.
html:
Our goal for the week was to collect the unlock for the blast furnace, the crafting station required for the next round of gear upgrades.  That meant braving a new game mechanic.

Welcome to Enshrouded

Up in the Albaneve Summits, above a specific altitude, the cold sets in and there is a whole frostbite mechanic that sets in. The flame at the top of the spire suggested this when we first got there, and you can experience the frost by just stepping out onto a balcony.

The flame opines

This is akin to the one in Valheim in the mountain biome, the difference being that in Enshrouded, it is a timer, akin to the shroud timer, so you’re never fully able to hang around forever in the frosty parts of the zone.  By default you get about two minutes of time before the cold starts to bite.

Frostbite timer running down

However, you can add points to your frost resistance, which adds time.  Things like the beef stew recipe and the pocket heater we unlocked last time around each have some frost resistance that will boost your time.  Ideally, you also want your gear to have frost resist as a stat as well, but much of that gear needs steel or refined silver, which requires the blast furnace.  We managed, across the group, to get between 6 and 12 minutes, with Potshot at the high end because there was one piece of gear with frost resist he could make, while Ula and I were at the lower end… though we couldn’t figure out why we were 3 minutes apart.  Still, we had a timer on how long we could be in the extreme cold at high altitude.

But first we had to get there… which was, if not difficult in the end, a bit confusing due to the way the map looks.  The map in the game is a bit of a mix in that it has a pretty detailed set of contour lines showing changes in altitude, but it often doesn’t show much detail of the terrain otherwise.  And the contour lines as not consistent in that they don’t bunch up to indicate a steep slope the way they would on a decent USGS map.  So you can see some lines and it won’t be clear if that rise in terrain is something you can walk up or it is a barrier… not to mention that no paths or roads are shown.

So it looked like if we glided down and went up a path I had scouted earlier on the far side of a mountain ridge, we would end up at our destination, as it was, on the map, right next to another quest objective about gathering Yak wool.  After a bit of climbing we made it there, a place that announced itself as the Quiet Caves, which did indeed have its share of yaks and fuzzy goats, the two tamable beasts up in the summits.  And there was also a cyclops.

The quiet caves, with a not so quiet cyclops… also, we have our anniversary party hats on

We got the quest update for arriving at the caves… we had already tamed a yak elsewhere and harvested wool, but the quest felt you needed to visit this particular spot on the map to have gotten the full experience… so it was time to take down the cyclops… which we did in fairly short order.

Cyclops down

I was enthused because for the next flame upgrade we needed a cyclops head.  However, this was just a run of the mill, every day cyclops and not the specific fel cyclops we needed, so that need remained unfulfilled.

Having done that we set waypoints for the mark on the map for the blast furnace quest objective, which was only about 300 meters away according to the marker, and then spent a good 30 minutes discovering that it was on the other side of the ridge line we glided over, but not before wending our way around behind the ridge and into some deadly shroud.

Enaldi gliding straight into the red shroud, which is the deadly shroud

Enaldi managed to scamper back out of the red shroud before it killed her, but it was a near run thing.  And this is why we need that fel cyclops head, so we can upgrade the flame which will make that shroud accessible.  Don’t try to find the logic in it, it is just content gating.  We have to find a boss somewhere before we can get past that.

After that wandering around it seemed pretty obvious that we needed to go up the other side of the ridge, up along the frozen river, up along a path that led into the mountain heights where the frost would begin to bite.

We made our way up that path, hitting the very obvious snow line and then plowing forward into the mists… which included a section where we had both a frost timer and a shroud timer.

There was some running about, and at least one dash back to below the snow line to reset timers and regroup.  You can put down a campfire in the cold to pause your timer, but it doesn’t regain any time.  You have to leave the frost zone for that.

We eventually found a path up out of the shroud do a gate… open, but with a trap right in the doorway… that looked promising.

This is athwart the path, so through it we’ll go

We went in, battled the mobs that showed up.  We were still in a bit of a rush with our frost timers still ticking down.  In the end we found a path out the back of that area that led us up to another base around a large stone building.

Here we go, this looks like the place

There were some mobs outside to clear… and they were getting up into the 30s for levels, so no push overs for us… but we got that done and went in the front door to find a big smelting and metalworking environment… the right place clearly, and warm enough to reset the frost timers, so we were good on that front.

It is nice and warm here

There were a couple of mobs to deal with in the first room, but in the next was the Scavenger Tyrant, the boss we needed to defeat, which turned into quite a battle.  Potshot went down, but we managed to rally and defeat the tyrant.  That got us the keys to the blast furnace and some other goodies from the boss and the chest in his back room.

We then went exploring, finding our way into a cave back behind the building which led down into a mine with more mobs, but also a range of items to harvest including iron, coal, and obsidian.  Always nice.

Down in the cave

Plus there as some more exposed magma in there, which heated the place up, so we were once again free of the frost timer and could fill up our bags.  There was even a repair station down there in case our picks were worn down.

Some iron to harvest, with a coal seam up in the background

Once we were done there, we recalled back to the spire where we started, then glided down to an Elixir Well that Potshot had scouted, both to chop down a shroud root for another skill point and to mine some silver he had spotted in the place.

That done, it was back to base to setup the blast furnace and start the production of steel and silver.

The blast furnace out in the workshop… I am sure the thatch roof won’t catch fire or anything

Also, you can tell this came after the big patch as one of our NPCs has decided to sleep on the ground.  Despite having beds assigned, the NPCs now seem to just flop wherever they are standing when night falls or when they just feel like the need a nap.

I went and crafted the tank armor set, which added quite a bit to my frost timer, which now runs close to 30 minutes.

The new armor set, no cosmetics visible now

That armor, plus a 90 damage single handed mace I picked up (along with that nice glowing sword I am wielding above), really increased my survivability.  I was able to rush my way past the mobs we battled with on our first trip up to reach the cave behind the blast furnace boss… though I avoided the boss… in order to harvest some more supplies.

Now we need to find that fell cyclops head so that we can upgrade the flame once more which will allow us to access that bit of red shroud we ran into.  The word is that the cyclops we need is down an elixir well not to far from where we found the blast furnace.
